intro: Erato costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican erato, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
